data.question: What is the critical temperature of the homospin Ne´el N-type ferrimagnet synthesized using a mixed ligand approach?
What materials were used in the synthesis of {[H2N(CH3)2][Co3(TDA)2(TZ)(H2O)]·3.5H2O}n?
What is the role of NaHCO3 in the synthesis of compound 1?
data.answer: To adjust the pH value to 6.46

data.question: Based on the synthesis conditions, what is the expected yield of pink rhombic crystals of compound 1?
What method was used to measure the magnetic susceptibilities of compound 1?
data.answer: Quantum Design SQUID MPMS XL-7 magnetometer

data.question: What is the significance of the negative Weiss constant observed in the magnetic data of compound 1?
data.answer: It suggests antiferromagnetic interactions as well as the spin–orbit coupling.

data.question: How does the compensation temperature of 5 K relate to the magnetic properties of compound 1?
data.answer: It indicates the temperature at which the sum of the net magnetizations for two sublattices becomes zero.

data.question: What is the role of the mixed ligand approach in the synthesis of the homospin Ne´el N-type ferrimagnet?
data.answer: It helps to arrange the spin carriers in particular arrays to achieve noncompensation of the magnetic moments.

data.question: Why are homospin ferrimagnets considered rare compared to heterospin ferrimagnets?
data.answer: Due to the rigorous prerequisites to achieve noncompensation of the magnetic moments of the same spin carriers.

data.question: What does the presence of a measurable coercive field and a remnant magnetization in compound 1 indicate?
data.answer: It suggests the soft magnetic character of compound 1.

data.question: How does the temperature dependence of ac magnetic susceptibilities confirm the occurrence of long-range magnetic ordering in compound 1?
data.answer: Both in-phase (w0) and out-of-phase (w00) reach maximum values at 9 K.
